properties.description: Eternity replaces wedding planners. With our digital CRM, we make wedding management easy for businesses and couples worldwide - allowing everyone to do what they love (no pun intended) without burning out.
properties.how_does_your_company_use_innovation__th:
We're finding novel solutions to century-old problems and improving traditional processes through out collaborative CRM - a business and client portal. We continuously aim to automate the predictable and humanise the exceptional with our technology.

Our business model combines SaaS with integrated FinTech payment processing - capturing and scaling efficiently - without being affected by wedding seasonality.
properties.how_does_your_product_contribute_to_a_he:
Ask anyone who is getting married - wedding planning is miserable. Over 64% of individuals choose to get married. That's over 5bn unhappy individuals planning "the happiest day of their lives". 

It takes a massive impact on our mental health, relationships and wellbeing - but is constantly overlooked.

Our product is a solution for the individuals, and the businesses that they communicate with. 

Bye-bye boring spreadsheets, hello Eternity.
properties.name: Eternity
properties.please_expand: We have the product, we need the right positioning and marketing to grow. Flight has proven expertise in elevating vertical tech platforms like Until & Zoe. Our niche business market impacts millions of people everyday, and we want to work with Flight to make a real impact.
properties.what_best_describes_your_stage_of_busine: I have a business that I want to scale
properties.what_is_your_usp__what_makes_you_differe:
Run by Gen-Z, for Gen-Z. We have a two-sided collaborative portal which is built for the vertical or wedding & events - allowing businesses and couples to interact, build relationships, and create magic in real time. We aren't just any random CRM that your business gets boxed into.

We also have partnerships and networks with some of the best brands - giving us a greater moat.
properties.where_is_your_business_based_: UK but wanting to scale to US

structured_data.executive_summary: Eternity is a SaaS solution that digitizes the wedding and events industry by providing an all-in-one, purpose-built, vertical-specific small business CRM. The company aims to modernize an old-fashioned industry that 'still operates like it's 1998' by offering integrated solutions for both businesses and couples.
structured_data.problem_statement: The wedding and events industry is broken and operates like it's 1998. Businesses in this industry face fragmented systems and processes across lead capture, nurturing, booking, collaboration, and closing deals. They currently use multiple disconnected tools including wedding directories, social media, word of mouth, websites, brochures, meeting bookings, proposals, quotes, invoices, contracts, itineraries, payment reminders, design notes, and reviews alongside multiple tabs and Excel spreadsheets.
structured_data.solution: Eternity offers an all-in-one integrated CRM solution for the wedding and events industry. It has two main components: a Business Portal for professionals (with client info, quotes, notes, analytics) and a Couples Portal (with documents, invoices, shared communication, and a free digital wedding planning suite). The platform handles everything from lead capture to closing deals.
structured_data.product_service_description: Eternity is a next-gen CRM platform with two main components: 1) Business Portal for wedding professionals that includes client info, quotes, notes, and analytics, and 2) Couples Portal that provides documents, invoices, shared communication, notifications, and a free digital wedding planning suite. The platform also includes directory and reviews features.
structured_data.market_size_opportunity: The global wedding and events industry size is $899 billion, with the UK industry size at £15 billion. Eternity is targeting a large market with significant revenue potential, comparable to other vertical SaaS markets like Beauty ($646bn global size, $43.4m revenue), Restaurant Reservations ($7.71bn industry size), and Fitness Coaches ($41.8bn industry size, $8.4bn revenue).
structured_data.business_model: Eternity has a multi-stream revenue model: 1) Monthly subscription at £24pm/£240pa plus £100 set-up fee per team member for solopreneurs and SMEs, 2) 1% transaction fees per invoice paid by businesses, and 3) 10% commission paid by affiliate partnerships through B2C couple referrals and UTM links, which has proven to generate £2m+ revenue for trusted platforms. They're launching payment processing in June as a second revenue channel.
structured_data.team: The company has a Gen-Z founder named Anshika (email: anshika@eternity-uk.com), which they highlight as a competitive advantage for understanding their target market. The team is planning to onboard sales and technology resources to move away from direct founder-led sales.
structured_data.traction_milestones: Eternity launched their MVP in October 2024 and has achieved: 10 paid beta business users (avg. £140pm), 700+ organic couples signed up, 3 partnerships secured with UK wedding directories, 90% month-over-month revenue growth since launch (£850pm in April 2025), and has raised £157k in SEIS funding. Their beta statistics show an average engagement time of 18 minutes per active user, and businesses invite an average of 30 couples to Eternity.
structured_data.financials_projections: The company has grown 90% MoM in revenue (£850pm in April 2025). Their 2025 targets include: 450 B2B paid users, 1,800 B2C active users, and raising £100k to reach 1,000 customers and £70k MRR (12-month runway). By 2026, they aim for 4,600 B2B paid users, 9,900 B2C active users, and £1.3m ARR. Their 2028 target is 28,000 B2B paid users, 56,000 B2C active users, and £10.4m ARR.
structured_data.funding_ask_use_of_funds: Eternity is raising £100k (SEIS & EIS) to: 1) enable payment processing and unlock a new revenue channel, 2) scale customer acquisition & partnerships, and 3) optimize onboarding to accelerate adoption. Their goal is to reach 1,000 vendors and £70k MRR with this funding.
structured_data.competition: Eternity's competitive landscape includes Bridebook (sold to The Knot Worldwide for £40m in 2020 at 18.5x multiple), Hitched (US unicorn with no UK presence or intention), Rock My Wedding (self-funded), and Joy (US-based, raised $2.3m F&F round and $2m in 2024, no UK presence or intention). Eternity's competitive advantages include: client-side portal, embedded CRM for vendors, integrated FinTech, two-sided network effects, comprehensive 'umbrella approach' from lead capture to close, rich data collection (B2B & B2C), and Gen-Z focus/founder.
structured_data.go_to_market_strategy: Eternity's go-to-market strategy includes: 1) Partnerships with UK wedding directories (3 already secured), 2) Direct founder-led sales (transitioning to a sales team), 3) Events (they took their MVP to market via events), 4) Leveraging two-sided network effects (businesses onboard avg. 30 couples, couples onboard avg. 10 businesses), and 5) Expanding UK nationwide before targeting international English-speaking markets like Australia, UAE, South Africa, India & US through partnerships. They also plan to expand into wider events including corporates & special occasions.

founder_profiles.name: Anshika Arora
founder_profiles.background_summary: Anshika Arora is the founder of Eternity, a B2B SaaS CRM designed to modernise the wedding industry by providing a unified platform for solopreneurs and SMEs. Her founder story is rooted in a direct, personal observation of the industry's reliance on outdated systems, giving her a clear and authentic mission. Prior to founding Eternity, she had a brief role as a Relationship Manager at HSBC after earning a BSc in Business Management from the University of Birmingham. Anshika has quickly established significant credibility within her target industry, highlighted by her appointment to the UK Wedding Association's Advisory Board as a Gen-Z and emerging trends advisor. Her LinkedIn content is strategic and focused, effectively communicating her vision for Eternity by drawing parallels to successful vertical SaaS platforms like Fresha and OpenTable. Through her podcast and industry engagement, she is actively building a personal brand and a strong network, positioning herself as a key voice for innovation in her sector.

investment_criteria_assessment.assessment_summary: Anshika Arora is a first-time founder with a strong mission and industry fit, building a SaaS platform for the wedding industry. She has not previously founded a relevant company nor worked at a major brand, but demonstrates strategic thinking, industry credibility, and thought leadership through her advisory board role and content.

market_analysis.industry_overview: The CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software market comprises platforms and tools that help businesses manage, analyze, and improve their interactions with customers. CRM systems centralize customer data from various channels (web, phone, email, chat, social media) to optimize communication, enhance customer satisfaction, and drive sales growth. The market includes cloud-based and on-premise solutions, serving organizations of all sizes across industries.
market_analysis.target_market_segment: UK-based SMEs and large enterprises across sectors such as retail, financial services, professional services, healthcare, and technology that require customer data management, sales automation, marketing integration, and customer support tools.
market_analysis.market_size_tam: Estimated at approximately £2.5 billion in 2024 for the UK CRM software market, based on proportional estimates from the global CRM market size.
market_analysis.market_size_sam: Estimated at £1.2 billion, focusing on UK businesses actively seeking CRM solutions (cloud and on-premise) and able to purchase from local or international vendors.
market_analysis.market_size_som: Estimated at £60-120 million for a new entrant capturing 5-10% of the UK CRM software market within 3-5 years, depending on differentiation and go-to-market strategy.
market_analysis.market_growth_rate_cagr: 11-13% CAGR (2024-2028), in line with global CRM market growth rates and UK digital transformation trends.
key_market_trends: Rapid adoption of cloud-based CRM solutions, especially among SMEs.
Integration of AI and automation for predictive analytics, lead scoring, and personalized marketing.
Growing demand for omnichannel customer engagement and unified customer data platforms.
Increased focus on data privacy and compliance (GDPR) in CRM implementations.
Expansion of vertical-specific CRM solutions (e.g., for healthcare, real estate, financial services).
market_analysis.competitor_landscape_summary: The UK CRM software market is highly competitive, with global leaders (Salesforce, Microsoft, HubSpot) holding significant market share, alongside regional players and niche providers. Competition is based on product features, integration capabilities, pricing, and customer support. Market consolidation and frequent product innovation are common.
